courses.title: Strategic Decision Making and Compromise Game
courses.description: A multifirm, competitive management simulation.  The objective is to sharpen intra-firm communications skills using the internet as the communications channel and the art of compromise.

courses.title: Cross-cultural Communications for Management
courses.description: Participants learn tools and information to improve communications skills with new approaches and increased understanding while taking into account the effects of cross-cultural differences on communications.

courses.title: Data Analysis for Business
courses.description: Covers common statistical tools for the analysis of corporate data such as descriptive statistics, probability concepts, sampling and estimation, hypothesis testing, and regression analysis.

courses.title: Organizational Behavior and Theory
courses.description: Students learn the basic concepts and principles of organizational behavior and utilize such to analyze and solve organizational decision-making problems.

courses.title: Leadership and Organizational Behavior
courses.description: This course focuses on the challenges in leading teams and organizations in increasingly complex, global, and dynamic business environments.

courses.title: Leadership and Organizational Behavior
courses.description: This course focuses on the challenges in leading teams and organizations in increasingly complex, global, and dynamic business environments.

courses.title: Economic Analysis of Decisions in a Global Economy
courses.description: Participants are provided with a non-traditional approach using an analytical method with a global perspective to the concepts and role of economics in the world environment.

courses.title: Financial and Managerial Accounting
courses.description: Course covers financial reporting and analysis issues facing firms, and managerial accounting information necessary for planning, controlling, and decision making within such firms.

courses.title: Information Systems for Global Organizations
courses.description: Tools and techniques to manage the information technology infrastructure that supports a global organization.

courses.title: Managerial Finance in World Markets
courses.description: A two-part course providing an understanding of finance concepts and how they are used.  The course then further integrates international and ethical considerations wherever applicable.

courses.title: Financial Management
courses.description: An introduction to finance. Topics include time value of money, capital budgeting, risk and return, capital structure, dividend policy, and working capital management.

courses.title: Manufacturing and Service Management
courses.description: Covers the basic conceptual and analytical skills that are required in managing operations and confronting operational problems in competitive markets.

courses.title: Managing Marketing
courses.description: Students are provided with an understanding of marketing and consumer behavior concepts and tools with an international environment approach.

courses.title: Product Strategies for Global Markets
courses.description: Developing and marketing new products and services with an emphasis on international markets.

courses.title: Risk Management and Technology Transfer
courses.description: A course based upon a combination of cases, historical data, and theoretical interpretation on the analysis and allocation of risk in international investment and technology transfer.

courses.title: Managing the Global Workforce
courses.description: A survey of global workforce management principles and the skills necessary to function effectively in a supervisory role in a global organization.

courses.title: Strategy
courses.description: Integrate knowledge of the functional areas of a business to understand how firms gain and sustain a competitive advantage in a globally competitive environment.

courses.title: Competing Globally
courses.description: This course utilizes case studies of companies in various industries and in national cultures to highlight organizational and cultural differences between major economies in the global environment.

courses.title: Entrepreneurship and Entrepreneurial Firms
courses.description: Participants explore the increasing importance of small and medium-sized businesses and new ventures in international business.

courses.title: National and International Regulation of Business
courses.description: Deals with learning how to control the legal aspects of international decisions.

courses.title: Quality, Sustainable Technology, Competitiveness
courses.description: Students learn the philosophy and techniques of strategic quality management while focusing on assessment and group decisions centered on sustaining technology and competitiveness.

courses.title: Leadership Skills and Processes
courses.description: Focuses on identifying and developing the attributes of successful leadership.

courses.title: Strategic Business Simulation
courses.description: A unifying course providing a simulated application of the material taught in the core courses of the program.

courses.title: Analysis of Emerging Technology
courses.description: A case-based course dealing with the role and impact of digital technology in large and small organizations, with special emphasis on multinational companies.

courses.title: Applied Entrepreneurship Seminar
courses.description: A case course building an information bank of theory and practice on start-up enterprises.  Several entrepreneurs will co-teach the course with a faculty leader.

courses.title: International Business Negotiations
courses.description: A role-play course involving the complex international negotiation simulation dealing with an international business enterprise and its relationship with one or more governments.

courses.title: International Finance
courses.description: Analysis of foreign exchange markets, exchange rate risk management, international portfolio investments, international asset pricing, cross-border M&A, and equilibrium conditions in international markets.

courses.title: Global Supply Chain and Electronic Commerce
courses.description: Examines business, managerial and economic issues in the management of global supply chains and the role of electronic commerce in the supply chain.

courses.title: Analysis of Global Environments I
courses.description: Analysis of a specific region through an international study tour with emphasis on understanding the economy, culture and business environment.

courses.title: Analysis of Global Environments
courses.description: Analysis of a specific region through an international study tour with emphasis on understanding its economy, culture and business environment.

courses.title: Analysis of Global Environments II
courses.description: Analysis of a specific region through an international study tour with emphasis on understanding the economy, culture and business environment.

courses.title: Global Strategy Project I
courses.description: Students work on a real world problem related to global strategy.  The focus in this course is on data collection and problem definition.

courses.title: Global Strategy Project I
courses.description: Students work on a real world problem related to global strategy. The focus in this course is on problem definition, data collection and client engagement management.

courses.title: Global Strategy Project II
courses.description: Students work on a real world problem related to global strategy.  The focus in this course is on defining a preliminary solution that has desirable characteristics.

courses.title: Global Strategy Project II
courses.description: Students work on a real world problem related to global strategy. The focus in this course is on problem definition, data collection and client engagement management.

courses.title: Global Strategy Project II
courses.description: Students work on a real world problem related to global strategy.  The focus in this course is on defining and presenting a comprehensive solution.

courses.title: Business Strategies for Sustainability
courses.description: Cross-functional strategies to address competitive and regulatory demands placed on firms for achieving sustainable business practices.
